data.description:
This is a recreation of the Pimp Star Performer watch by Tokyoflash, including animations.  The watch features four columns of digits, representing the hour and minute digits respectively.  Every minute, an animation is started which changes to the new time indication. 

The watchface also features a PM indicator in the shape of a Martini glass (because night time is drinking time!).

The battery indicator has the following colors :
- above 60% : gray
- between 40-60% : blue
- between 20-40% : yellow
- below 20% : red

latest_release.release_notes:
- Added support for Pebble Time Round
- Increased & improved readability
- Added user configuration

data.description:
A stylish analog watchface that brightens your day!

The hour is shown with bars extending from the outer ring in the usual analog positions.  
The minute is the last orange line radiating out from the inner ring, also in usual analog positions.  
The partial font for day of month, day of week and month adds a cryptic feel to the watch.

Screenshots show:  
(1) 08:23 Tuesday September 8th
(2) 06:00 Sunday August 30th
(3) 05:55 Wednesday September 9th
(4) 05:19 Wednesday August 26th
(5) 01:15 Tuesday December 13 (+Quick View)

Note.
The 15, 30 & 45 minutes can still be identified when the matching hour is set, by the extended orange line within the hour ring.

 
This watchface design was created by Jos√© Manuel Otero, from Spain, and is published with his permission.   You can follow him on:
https://www.facebook.com/TTM-Technotimemachine-578290348850436/timeline/

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed defect where hour line was not being drawn to edge of screen on rectangular watches (introduced in last update)

data.author: Professor Hornbill
data.description:
If you are familiar with the TIX clock, tixtox is a customizable watchface that behaves similarly.  The top two sections of the watchface represent the first and second digits of the hour and the bottom two sections represent the first and second digits of the minute.  If no lights are lit, that represents 0, if 1 light is lit that represents 1 and so on.  For example, if the first digit of the hour has one light lit and no other sections have any lights lit you are looking at 10:00.  In the included screenshots, the first one is showing 19:27, the second is showing 19:28 and the third is showing 7:30.  Every time the screen updates the lights in each section are randomly turned on and off. 

This watchface has taken advantage of Slate and includes multiple customization settings allowing you to set the color of the digits as well as the background.  You can also hide the unlit squares in each section (always black) as well as changing how often the screen is updated.  The 24/12 hour display is based on the settings on your watch.
data.title: TixTox

data.description:
All-in-one clean display of the time, date, day and battery life! Todeloj is a Spanish mix of the word "todo", meaning all, and "reloj" meaning clock or watch.  

I am frustrated not being able to see all the relevant information in one Watchapp and decided to develop my own. By the 1.0 release you will see all the information you need in a glance with clarity and succinctness of: 
 - Current time 
 - Month and day of month 
 - Day of the week 
 - Battery capacity 
 - Charging status

data.description: Hextime is a new way to tell the time. It divides the day into 16 hex hours, not 24. There are 256 hex minutes in a hex hour and 16 hex seconds in a hex minute. A hex hour is 1.5 normal hours, so 8 o'hex is midday. For those who are interested, the standard is specified here: http://www.intuitor.com/hex/hexclock.html

latest_release.release_notes: Initial release.

data.description:
The current time blurs to reveal the next minute. A flick of the wrist displays the date, which can be disabled in the settings.
To change digit colors: use settings.
To change background: within two seconds of launching the watchface, flick your wrist.

If you like this watchface, put the items in your room into three distinct piles and then arrange those piles by density. Or return to this app, scroll through all the watchfaces until you find mine, and hit the heart button. Both seem equally likely.

EffectLayer used for color inversion.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixes issue whereby the date gets stuck.

data.title: Blur

data.description:
This watchface is a branch of Multifunctional 7 Segment which uses METAR weather data from AVWX and openweathermap.org simultanously. It is made mainly for day-to-day usage by pilots. 
The information displayed at the 10 positions is highly configurable.

data.title: Metar 7 Segment for Pilots

data.author: Hypermedia linked by Isobar
data.description:
This watchface shows Air Quality Index for you location. Air Quality Index is downloaded from a automated measurement device nearest to you and it is calculated on the basis of dust, carbon monoxide, nitrogen dioxide, sulphurt dioxide and humidity levels.

Lower Air Quality Index means better air to breathe!

Air Quality Index is updates several times a day. The watchface also shows current weather, date&time and battery status.
data.title: Air Quality & Weather

data.description:
Another large number watchface.  It doesn't get much easier to read.

Here time on a classic pebble/steel is displayed with a different font versus on the PT/PTS.

On the classic it uses a square font to match the square screen,  while on a PT/PTS it uses a rounded font to match the rounded corners of the display.

You can also choose from a few styles in the settings.

The time separator has a few purposes - as battery indicator, charge indicator, and for bluetooth loss.

data.description:
I love the famous Simplicity watchface, but, every so often I wanted to see the seconds also.  Except, not all the time.  

So, I made this.  Simple date and time is displayed.  Now, if you want to see the second counter, just flick your wrist.  

After a certain amount of time, the seconds will go away, and your watch will be back in battery saving, slow, one frame per minute, mode.

data.description:
This is my second watchface for PebbleTime. It is inspired by the Color watchface of the Apple Watch.  

Shows: 
- digital time 
- analog time 
- weekday and date 
- month
- battery percentage 
- bluetooth connection

Options: 
- enable/disable second hand
- enable/disable bluetooth status
- choose color of the watchface
- select your individual monogram (up to 3 characters)

No further updates or support... I've sold my Pebble! Sorry.

latest_release.release_notes: -fixed the lag of minute hand when second hand is disabled

data.description:
Arc watchface with arcs for hours (inner) and minutes (outer).
Has battery percentage in the middle and date below.
Colours can be inverted and battery percentage and date visibility can be configured through app settings.
Vibrate on the hour and on Bluetooth disconnect can also be configured in the settings.

v1.4

- Add houlyVibrate option
- Add bluetoothVibrate option

data.title: Arc Watchface

data.author: Stefan Heule

changelog.release_notes: - Add "Mon | 28 May" date format
- Change ticks for 3/6/9/12 on square watch faces again.

- Fix weather bug.
- Increase tick thickness for 3/6/9/12 on square watch face.

- Use temperature, not apparent temperature for darksky weather.
- Respect quiet time.

- Bring back support for Pebble and Pebble Steel.
- Improve font on Pebble 2.

- Fix wrong color bug for hour ticks.
- Add new date format "2:10 | Mon 22 (date/time)" and "14:10 | Mon 22 (date/time)".

- New date format options (including digital time and larger font)
- New font and much better font drawing library resulting in smoother text
- Second hand option (disabled by default; mostly implemented by Tam√°s Iv√°n)
- Experimental support for the Pebble Time 2 (emery platform)
- Remove support for aplite platform (due to memory constraints)

- Optimized for Pebble OS 4.0
- Added support for diorite platform
- Addes support for Timeline Quick View
- Updated forecast.io to darksky.net (their service got renamed).

- Square version of the watch face.
- Use actual temperature rather than apparent temperature for forecast.io.
- Change default refresh rate for weather to 30 minutes.
Fix bug where the minute ticks were not shown in the right color if hour ticks were turned off.
Fix bug where the bluetooth logo was not displayed on chalk platform when weather was disabled.
Fix bug that causes the watch face to essentially not work on the aplite platform, due to an out-of-memory condition.
- Add weather information. Fully configurable: location, unit (Fahrenheit or Celsius), source (openweathermap.org, forecast.io, wunderground.com), refresh time. Moves out of the way of watch hands.
Localize date display.

- Update to latest SDK, allowing aplite to make use of new APIs.  The watchface now looks much better on aplite.
- Aplite can now use the color gray (dithered black/white).
- Improve tick size again.

- Fix a bug where the background color setting for 30% battery level was ignored.
- Increase the size of the minute ticks on the PTR (they were mostly covered by the bezel).

- Allow for a different color of the battery icon on low battery (used by default on PTR).
- Separate local storage of configurations for different platforms.
- Fix possible bug in local storage on the watch on upgrade.
- Show version information in the configuration
Add support for Pebble Time Round
Add a black/white version for the original Pebble

data.description:
This is a usable and elegant analog watchface for the Pebble Time.  It's designed such that the watch hands never cover the date or weather information.  It's main features are:

- High contrast colors, clearly visible in most light conditions.
- Display of the current date (day and month) as well as day of the week.
- The date display is never obstructed by the watch hands.  If they would cover the date, the date moves slightly to the side.
- Display the current weather information (icon and temperature). Just like the date, this information is never obstructed.
- Weather information in Celcius or Fahrentheit. Weather information source is configurable to use openweathermap.org, darksky.net, or wunderground.com.
- Weather is displayed for the current location by default, but it is possible to set a fixed location.
- Display of the battery level.
- Change in background for low battery levels (yellow at 30%, orange at 20%, and red at 10%).
- Vibrates when the bluetooth connection is lost or regained, shows an information overlay for a few seconds and keeps showing an icon when no connection is available.
- Fully configurable, both in terms of appearance (colors, minute/hour ticks, etc.) as well as behavior (if and when to vibrate, show messages, etc.).
- Square or round version.
- Supports Timeline Quick View.

latest_release.release_notes: - Add "Mon | 28 May" date format

data.description:
Who needs Top of the Rock when you have Pebble? Horizon NYC puts a tiny, pixelated window to New York City on your wrist.

Featuring:
~ 14 geographically accurate times of day
~ 12 weather conditions
~ Up to date Empire State Building lights
~ Rotating spire colors
~ Configurable time/date/temperature formats
~ Bluetooth disconnect alert
~ Offline support* - see the sky even when you're trapped in the subway

*Data connection required for weather refresh

data.author: Nick Esposito

changelog.release_notes: Fix Battery icon issue for PT2

Version 4.5: Added native support for the larger screen size (200 x 228) of the 2016 Pebble Time 2, so that there are no black borders: created larger (and smoother) digits, adjusted tick marks and calendar, and moved the battery and Bluetooth indicators.
Added support for Pebble 2 (Diorite)

1.  As promised, those of you with B&W Pebble and Pebble Steels now have two font colors (white and gray), and can customize their time font colors!
2.  Fixed very embarrassing calendar issue in which December had 30 days! (Thank you, Rachel Y.!)
3.2: Added sliding calendar; made additional code changes to increase battery efficiency.

First release containing O.G. Pebble and Pebble Time support! Coming soon: With the upcoming release of software version 3.x for the Pebble and Pebble Steel, there will be support for shades of gray (optional separate shade for each digit). Stay tuned for more...

Major new release. Added ability to set multiple colors (each digit can have its own color), and -- for a short time only, and for no adequately-explored reason (other than it's winter here in the Northern Hemisphere) -- optional snow-covered digits (no, not FALLING snow, that'd kill the battery)! Stay tuned for more...
Bug fix release, and modified some code to improve battery life.
Added optional battery indicator, made Bluetooth indicator optional, and for Pebble Round, moved the battery and Bluetooth indicators to the center-left and center-right of the screen.
Added support for Pebble Round
Yet another fix for the calendar
Fixed calendar issue causing watchface to crash on Oct. 1

latest_release.release_notes: Fix Battery icon issue for PT2

data.author: Josh S

changelog.release_notes: Should no longer crash
Fixed 12-hour time being displayed with leading 0 (e.g. 04:45 for 4:56 pm)
Added setting to either use GPS for location, or specify city
Fixed a bug that caused the Pebble watch to go into recovery mode when bluetooth was disconnected
Added API key for weather requests.

Added line between time and date to better mimick the Simplicity watchface
Added settings to control the line for those who don't want it (more settings coming soon!)
Minor backend changes
Fixed bad formatting when no units are saved and weather is unavailable (only happens on first run, if weather is not available)
Fixed watch not vibrating on bluetooth disconnect (broken in v1.1)

Renamed to sWeather
Watch now remembers weather for up to 30 minutes before checking again

This is the first release. Features include:

Current temperature based on location
Units (Celsius vs Fahrenheit) based on country
Bluetooth icon and vibrate on lost connection to phone

data.description:
Like the watchface? Remember to heart it!

Simple watch design with current local temperature (updated every 10 minutes). 

This watch was based on the "Simplicity" watchface included by default. It is meant to be as simple as possible, but still provide whatever features it can. Current features:
‚Ä¢ Temperature is automatically retrieved based on current location (can be overridden from settings)
‚Ä¢ Weather data is stored and used for up to 30 minutes when switching away from watchface
‚Ä¢ Units (Celsius or Fahrenheit) are based on current country
‚Ä¢ Currently the following use Fahrenheit: Bahamas, Belize, the Cayman Islands, Palau, and the United States
‚Ä¢ Icon and vibrate to notify you when bluetooth is disconnected (No need to clutter the screen when everything is fine, right?)

Features I plan to add:
Configuration:
‚Ä¢ Optionally add line separating time/date
‚Ä¢ Units override (mainly for those traveling)
‚Ä¢ Optionally have icon when bluetooth is connected
‚Ä¢ Optionally display battery level
‚Ä¢ Optionally display icons indicating weather conditions (rain, snow, thunder etc...)

If you find any bugs, or want certain features added, please don't hesitate to contact me so I can prioritize it.

latest_release.release_notes: Should no longer crash

data.description: Hack Dads came to Pebble Rocks Boulder with the intention of making a fully functional Pebble Smartstrap that runs without the need for an external power supply. We have achieved this goal with the Hack Dads Pebble Altimeter Smartstrap. The Hack Dads Pebble Altimeter Smartstrap uses a small microprocessor and altimeter sensor to feed elevation data to a Pebble Time watchface. The watchface processes this data and creates an informational view that shows current altitude with accent or decent status. By flicking your wrist, a real-time graph can be viewed. The Hack Dads Pebble Altimeter Smartstrap creates a complete example of how a low power smartstrap can be achieved using just a few external components.  *** Requires v3.4 firmware and Hack Dads Pebble Altimeter Smartstrap for proper operation ***

latest_release.release_notes: Initial beta release. :)

data.description:
WearableBI lets you understand your business as well as you understand the time. 

It provides enterprise tools for managing a fleet of watchfaces, including a custom watchface builder that lets you show your data your way.

Getting started is easy and you can be up and running in no time with our Microsoft Excel and Google Docs spreadsheet uploaders. Alternately, we provide the APIs and advice for connecting to much more robust BI platforms.

Signup now at www.wearablebi.com

data.description:
Abstracted is a concept that uses art to display time.

To Read:
(The displayed time is 4:36 PM)

Hours are the large horizontal black bars. They act as tally marks (4 bars = 4 hours past 12, 5 bars = 5 hours past 12). Hours will count, starting from the top of the screen, up to 11, and at 12 will reset to 0 (0 hours past 12).

Minutes are the thin diagonal stripes on the left side. They too act as tally marks, counting up to 59 and at 60/0 will reset to 0. They will fill up from the bottom of the screen to the black triangle in the corner.

PM is represented by the large grey shade on the bottom right of the screen. If it is there, it is PM, if it is not, it is AM.

Note: Abstracted is in 12hr format only.

latest_release.release_notes:
v1.1 Compatible with newer SDK
v1.0 Release

data.description: Here be dragons warning! You're probably looking for the Nightscout watchface without BWP support. This is an experimental Nightscout watchface based on the classic watchface, with additional support for displaying BWP, IOB and BWP's projected outcome based on the IOB. Note this watchface will likely disappear once the main branch implements the features in this version. Further, the watchface assumes BWP and IOB plugins are enabled for your Nightscout installation.

data.description: Pinwheel is a colorful watch face that changes every minute.  Day of the month is in the center circle, which is red if Bluetooth is lost.  Battery level on a bottom graph shows red when 20% or less, and blue when charging. White dots indicate 10% battery levels.

latest_release.release_notes: V3.1 Changed Menu Icon to 25x25

data.title: Pinwheel

data.author: Dalpek

changelog.release_notes: Bug Fixes
Ability to change colors, Added bluetooth notifications and date enable/disable
Fixed Android settings bug.

data.description:
Modern and Minimalistic. Hour=Left+Right triangles, Minutes=Top+Bottom triangles. (08:32 in thumbnail).
With the flick of the wrist you can see the Month=Left+Right triangles and date. Settings for colors, date display and Bluetooth warning.

latest_release.release_notes: Bug Fixes

data.title: XD by Dalpek

data.author: ILOC.COM

changelog.release_notes: Future proof for Pebble and Pebble Time when they upgrade to newer phone app.
Added support for Pebble and Pebble Steel. Added support for Simplified Chinese and Traditional Chinese.
Added color themes, selectable in phone settings.
Improved font for date using custom font.
Added support for French/fran√ßais, German/Deutsche, and Spanish/Espa√±ol.
Added splash screen. Improved memory management.

Added support for Pebble Time Round.
Fixed comma after month to display descender.

1. Removed leading zero ("0") in 12-hour format for 1:00AM through 9:59AM.
2. Increased font size for AM/PM in 12-hour format for readability.

Dual timezone watchface. Top is local time. Bottom is universal time (UTC).
Very useful for pilots and Amateur Radio (ham) operators.

Initial release. Only supports Pebble Time, which supports timezones.

data.description:
Dual timezone watchface. Top is local time. Bottom is universal time (UTC). Very useful for pilots, amateur radio (ham) operators, and astronomers. Color theme is selectable in watch face Settings. Language is selectable in Pebble Settings.

changelog.release_notes: Again fixed some issues for the German language.
Rewritten the german language algorithm
Fixed a problem with the German Language.
Fixed issues with the German language
Quick bug fixes
Fixed issues with german, french, italian and spanish language!
The first release of TextTime. Please report any mistakes in displaying the time.

data.description: TextTime replaces DutchWatch and is now multilingual. It will display time in words for the languages dutch, english, italian, german, french and spanish. On the configscreen you can change the language and the colors of the watchface.

latest_release.release_notes: Again fixed some issues for the German language.

data.title: TextTime

data.author: RK ELECTRICS
data.description: This is a basic watchface with Army Green background. Shows the time and date along with battery level. If you like it, leave a heart! Want a watchface made? Let me know!

- ÎÑ§Í∑ÄÌâÅÏù¥Ïóê Ï†êÏúºÎ°ú +1Î∂Ñ ~ +4Î∂Ñ ÌëúÌòÑ (5Î∂Ñ Îã®ÏúÑ Î∂ÑÏπ®Ï≤òÎüº ÏÉùÍ∞ÅÌïòÏãúÎ©¥ Îê©ÎãàÎã§)

New in 2.0
- Configurable App!
- Custom hourly vibration!
- On/Off font swap mode! (use solid font for background[off] font)
New in 1.3
- Improve display logic (may be faster than before)
- You can check every minute (clockwise dot indicator) 
   +No dot : +0 min
   +Dot at upper right : +1 min
   +Dot at bottom right : +2 min
   +Dot at bottom left : +3 min
   +Dot at upper left : +4 min

Nestedly Inspired by soomtong
(http://github.com/soomtong/HannaClock)
who inspired by Toby Yun.(http://tobyyun.com/wooclock/)

The font used in here was published in a public.(http://www.woowahan.com)
